messages: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:10): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: what should I do with <mrow><none/><mprescripts/></mrow> and why?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:10): the dtd has two modes
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:10): a "compatibility" mode, and a strict mode that actually matches the spec
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:10): one checks for things like <mfrac> having two children, the other doesn't
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:11): the relax stuff you provided implements the wrong one
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:19): I don't like leaving HTML+MathML+SVG integration to CDF. They've dragged their feet with "by-inclusion" long enough
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:20): the great thing about cdf
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:21): is that even if they decide that this _is_ their responsibility
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:21): we'll be done and will have solved the problems long before they get their act together
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:21): I think <ext> is worse than a new insertion mode on <svg> and <math>
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:24): http://www.thinkgeek.com/stuff/41/titaniumlabyrinth.html?cpg=70H is hilarious
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:24): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: i agree, it has all the problems of a new insertion mode, and then some

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:28): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: if you have Google data on <math> not being able to establish a scope for backwards compat, do you have data that the Web would break if <svg> had its own tree builder scope?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:31): i haven't looked at svg in much detail yet, only started looking today
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:31): but what kind of problem could you envisage
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:35): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I don't expect the Web to break. I want an SVG insertion mode.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:35): the problems mentioned with mathml exist with svg too
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:36): does IE8 show the traits of having a tree builder scope for SVG and MathML?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:38): i have some more concrete numbers for mathml now
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:38): out of about 3/4 of a billion documents:
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:38): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: does IE8 already break you compat assumptions (if xmlns is present)?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:38): ~50000 had a <math> or <foo:math> element
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:39): ~40000 had <math> and only presentational mathml elements, no content mathml, no <semantic>, no <annotation-xml>
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:40): ~800 seemed to have only content mathml
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:40): ~500 seemed to have both
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:40): ~900 seemed to have <semantics> or <annotation-xml> elements
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:40): ~10000 had <math> elements but didn't seem to have any other mathml elements
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:41): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: If you a couple at random and load them in Firefox, do you get a different content type from what google saw?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:41): If you take a couple...
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (10:41): did anyone find out what the <hype> element did?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:42): i screwed up the sampling for content mathml and pres+content mathml, so i can't give reliable urls for those two
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:43): I didn't find out, but it sounds like it could be to <blink> what <em> is to <i> :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:44): interesting, most of the presentational mathml pages seem to from freepatentsonline
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:45): http://www.hindawi.com/GetArticle.aspx?doi=10.1080/15604280212526&e=cta is another example
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:46): a strikingly worthless use of mathml if ever there was one...
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:47): http://www.emis.de/journals/HOA/JIA/2d12.html?doi=10.1155/JIA/2006/15063 is text/html
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:47): even in firefox
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:47): and contains mathml with prefixes
